io.github.aetherv.databaseInterface

Interface ConnectionInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MySQLInterface

    public interface ConnectionInterface
    An Interface that specifies how a particular Database shall interact with the API. As an example, MySQLInterface, implements this Interface for a mysql based server

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Connection createConnection(String usr, String pwd, String url, int port)
      Creates a connection to a database server, based on the specifications obtained via the parameters.
      void executePreparedStatement(PreparedStatement pStmt)
      Execute a prepared Statement that does not return a Result Set.
      Connection getConnection()
      Returns the current connection for use.
      ResultSet queryPreparedStatement(PreparedStatement pStmt)
      Execute a prepared Statement that should return a result set.

    • Method Detail

      • executePreparedStatement

        void executePreparedStatement(PreparedStatement pStmt)
                       throws SQLException
        Execute a prepared Statement that does not return a Result Set. An example of which would be the INSERT based SQL query.
        Parameters:
        pStmt - A prepared statement which shall be executed by this method
        Throws:
        SQLException - An exception pertaining to flaws in the given Prepared Statement's SQL syntax.

      • queryPreparedStatement

        ResultSet queryPreparedStatement(PreparedStatement pStmt)
                          throws SQLException
        Execute a prepared Statement that should return a result set. An example would be a SELECT based SQL query.
        Parameters:
        pStmt - A prepared statement which shall be executed by this method.
        Returns:
        A Result Set containing the data from the SQL query.
        Throws:
        SQLException - An exception pertaining to flaws in the given Prepared Statement's SQL syntax.

      • createConnection

        Connection createConnection(String usr,
                            String pwd,
                            String url,
                            int port)
                     throws SQLException
        Creates a connection to a database server, based on the specifications obtained via the parameters.
        Parameters:
        usr - Username for logging into the database server.
        pwd - Password for logging into the database server.
        url - URL of the database server. If you want, you can already specify which specific database you wish to access, however this can be done during the querying as well.
        port - The port of the database
        Returns:
        A Connection Object that contains the properties specified.
        Throws:
        SQLException - Exceptions involving the login procedure. Includes invalid login data, invalid permissions and other errors.

      • getConnection

        Connection getConnection()
        Returns the current connection for use. Particularly helpful for generating prepared Statements.
        Returns:
        Current Connection. If no Connection is present, return null.
